blog.name: whumpingwithirondad
blog.title: Whumpingwithirondad
blog.description: Owners: wordscorrupt and irondadgroupie. A magical place where all your iron dad whump dreams come true. Send us a prompt/concept/headcanon and we make it come alive.

summary: Not sure if you’ve done this yet, but Peter with appendicitis. Maybe he hasn’t been feeling well for days but he hasn’t said...
question: Not sure if you’ve done this yet, but Peter with appendicitis. Maybe he hasn’t been feeling well for days but he hasn’t said anything besides an off handed comment here or there until things start to ramp up in the middle of the night and he’s in agony
answer:
Our thoughts on this as follows! 

He has a bad stomach ache the past couple days but maybe he just ate bad food or something. Plus, Tony seems to be in a bad mood (maybe over the company or avengers) and he doesn’t want to bother him about his stomach hurting.

irondadgroupie

Tony has a lot or work stress and Peter tries to be invisible but helpful. The boy keeps eating paracetamol to help with the pain and uses a Hot water bottle. But one night, the pain gets so bad Peter can do nothing but scream

wordscorrupt

But moving it around makes it even worse, but he cant help but wither in pain. His screams eventually reach Tony who runs into his room.

irondadgroupie

Tony of course thinks Peter ran Off to patrol and was hiding an injury. But something was wrong because Peter could barely speak and was curled up in a Ball"what hurts, kid? What hurts?“ Tony rubbed the boy’s limbs, trying to locate a broken bone.

wordscorrupt

Peter curls up tighter and is barely able to wheeze out that his stomach hurts. "Okay, kiddo. It’s okay. Show me where it hurts exactly.”

wordscorrupt

Tony has to help Peter uncurl and lay back down on the bed. Peters able to point with shaky fingers to the part that hurts him the most right now and Tony bites his lip as his kid point to his right side. “Okay, bud I’m just gonna feel a little bit.” “NO!” “Kiddo, I’ll be gentle I swear.”

irondadgroupie

Tony’s fingers barely put any pressure on the place Tony first chooses, the one he fears, when Peter screams and curls up again "Okay, kiddo" Tony breathes deeply to calm his fears, Peter would be fine, Peter would be fine. “You need to be very brave now. We’re going down go medbay. Can you walk or do you want me to carry you?

wordscorrupt

Tony helps Peter up but the second he tries to swing his legs over the bed he doubles over in pain. “Okay kiddo. No walking for you.” Tony picks him up ever so gently trying not to jostle him too much. But it still ends up with Peter crying in his shoulder. “Sshhh” Tony presses a kiss to Peters head before starting the walk down to the medbay having already ordered Friday to notify the doctors down there that they were coming.

irondadgroupie

"It hurts,” Peter whined and sobbed. “It hurts so bad!” “I know, kiddo,” Tony sighed as Peter clutched him tighter. “Just be brave for me.” “I can’t,” The boy cried. “Hurts, it hurts, Tony, help, hurts!”

wordscorrupt

“I know kiddo. We’re getting you help I promise.” Tony pretty much broke the doors entering the medbay. He saw a bed surrounded by doctors and nurses ready for them. “See bud the good doctors and nurses here are gonna take care of you know.”

irondadgroupie

Tony softly lies Peter on the bed, shushing him all the while. “I know, I know, just relax, you’re safe.” He turned to the Doctor who immediately pressed on Peter’s stomach. The boy cried out as soon as fingers touches his skin. “Can you give him anything for the pain?”

wordscorrupt

“We’ll try to get an IV in and get him some pain medication. We’ll need to take him for a CT scan as well to see whether or not it is appendicitis.” The doctor told Tony who sighed and nodded his head before turning back to Peter who was still crying from being prodded by the doctor.

irondadgroupie

“Peter, look there,” He pointed at a nurse who was holding Peter’s hand and trying to insert a needle. “They’re giving you the good stuff. You’ll feel better soon.” Tony wiped at the boy’s tears with his thumb. “When was the last time he ate?” The doctor asked Tony as the nurse told Peter was showing signs of dehydration.

wordscorrupt

“I don’t know. Maybe last night.” Now that Tony thought about it he hadn’t seen the kid in a few days other than maybe a few minutes a day. He was rushing to get the latest upgrades done on the teams weapons and his mind had drifted away from the mid

wordscorrupt

“Let’s get him set up with fluids and pain meds. Then straight to CT. We might be looking at appendicitis here mister Stark and if that’s the case then we’ll need to get him into surgery fast.”

irondadgroupie

“O- okay,” Tony nodded and watched how a nurse hanged up a bag of saline to the pole and prepared another one. Peter whimpered in pain and curled on his side. A tear slid down his nose.

irondadgroupie

“Hey,” Tony rubbed his back in comfort. “Hey, hey, you’re okay, kiddo. It’s okay. Look, they’re giving you the good stuff.” “It hurts,” Peter sobbed. “I know, I know you’re in pain but hang with me for a few minutes longer.” He brushed Peter’s hair from his forehead and frowned. “He feels a bit warm, is that normal?”

wordscorrupt

“A fever is normal. When it gets too high it’s time to worry because that means it’s burst and an infection has started in.” The doctor informed him as he pressed a thermometer into Peters ear. The kid whimper and Tony shushed him gently reaching down to press a kiss to his head once the doctor was done.

irondadgroupie

“101, this is normal, his body is fighting,“ the doctor assured Tony who nodded, his fingers caressing Peter’s hair. "I am going to inject some pain killers now, Peter,” a nurse inserted a needle into the IV port. “We’ll start moving you to the CT-scan. Mr Stark, do you want to accompany him?”

wordscorrupt

As if that was even a question. Tony nodded his head and once the nurse injected the pain medication Peters cries dwindled down until they were just whimpers and the occasional sniffle. “There you go buddy. You’ve got to good stuff now.” Tony commented holding one of Peters hands as they rolled him down for his scan.

irondadgroupie

“It’s-” Peter gulped and Tony squeezed his hand. “It’s bearable now. I’ll be okay.” “Of course you will be,” Tony smiled. They finally reached the right room and Peter was lifted from the stretcher to the bed that led to the enormous machine. “Peter, we can put on some music, would you like that?”

wordscorrupt

“Okay.” His voice sounded timid and tony was quick o reassure him that he was not going to leave. “This shouldn’t take more than a couple minutes Peter. “ Peter nodded his head at the doctors words. Tony gave his hand one last squeeze before he was being moved into the machine.

irondadgroupie

Peter was a champion, Tony had to admire him, the boy stayed still the entire time. The machine made a lot of noise. Finally, Peter was released. “It’s definitely appendicitis,” The doctor skimmed the pictures on the Pad. “Yeah, I could have told you that,” Tony grit his teeth. “Seriously, why waste so much time?”

wordscorrupt

“We had to make sure mr. stark that it wasn’t anything else. No one would have appreciated us going in cutting him open if we didn’t have to. Right?” Tony huffed and nodded his head before urging them to get him to surgery fast.

irondadgroupie

Tony helped Peter get out of his pajamas and settle into the hospital bed with a thin blanket. “I want to stay with him till you put him under,” Tony told the doctor as they started walking down the corridor to reach the operation theater. Everything was set up, surgeon had been called and the only thing missing was the patient.

wordscorrupt

The doctor put up no arguments not like Tony would have cared. Once they reached the operating room Tony personally lifted Peter up into his arms and settled him down onto the operating bed. “Mister Stark?” Peters scared voice called out for him as the staff started to surround him taping stuff to his chest and strapping his arms down to the side.

irondadgroupie

“Easy,” Tony crouched to eye-level with the kid and stroked his hair. “Ignore everything around you. Just focus on me, okay?” “We’re just setting up some monitors, Peter,” The surgeon came in and smiled at the boy. “This one measures your pulse, this oxygen levels.” “Do I need a ventilator?” Peter asked timidly.

wordscorrupt

“Well put a tube down your throat once the anesthesia kicks in but take it out after the surgery is over and before you wake up bud. So you’ll never notice it at all.” The surgeon explained as gently as possible. Peters eyes still welled up with tears tonight and he looked up Towards his mentor.

irondadgroupie“It’s okay, it’s not nearly as scary as it sounds,” Tony comforted the boy. “Your throat might be a little sore afterwards but hey, nothing some ice cream won’t cure!”

wordscorrupt

Peter managed a little smile at that and nodded his head. Tony saw one of the surgeons come closer with the mask and he took a deep breath. “Alright bud. Just have to breathe nice and deep for the doctor now and the next time you wake up I’ll be right there.”

irondadgroupie

Peter panicked once the mask was set over his face. “No,” he moaned and tried to turn away. “Peter,” Tony grabbed the mask and hovered it over the boy’s mouth and nose. “Just keep your eyes on me, okay. Count to ten,” He pressed the mask on Peter’s face while his other hand caressed the boy’s hair.“ Smells funny,” Peter muttered and blinked slowly. His chest moved up and down. The boy gulped and paled. “Feel sick.”

wordscorrupt

“Shhh, kiddo. That’s just the medicine working now. Don’t fight it buddy.” Tony cooed still keeping the mask pressed against Peters face with the other ran through his hair. Peter was still looking up at him but slowly his eyes started to drift shut until he was completely out of it.

irondadgroupie

“I think he is asleep,” Tony whispered to the surgeon although there was no danger of Peter hearing them. “Good, keep the mask on for a little while longer, maybe pull his head back a little so his airways stay open.” Tony obeyed the instructions. He set his hand on Peter’s chest, finger tapping in rhythm with the boy’s pulse and measuring how deep breaths he took. 

Have I ever told how much I love Tony calling Peter buddy? :D

wordscorrupt

I love all the little pet names we have tony call peter 

irondadgroupie

Buddy always makes it feel like Peter is his special little friend, his sidekick, the one he trusts :D

wordscorrupt

Tony stayed as they intubated Peter, holding his breath the entire time. “He’s in good hands mister Stark. One of our nurses can escort you out.” The surgeon told him once they had Peter settled and strapped down. Tony leaned down pressing a few kisses to Peters head. “Be good for them kiddo. I’ll see you in a bit.”

irondadgroupie

Everytime you write that “Be good for the doctor’s, kiddo,” I can’t help but think of the headcanon where Peter was seriously injured and could die on the operating table and Tony was coaxing him to stay alive

wordscorrupt

I know. That’s why I love it so much

irondadgroupie

Time moved slowly. Tony had coffee, tried to read some magazines, he could have done some work but his Pad and phone were at his room and there was no way he was leaving MedBay until Peter woke up. Who knew what could happen during the time? The kid could have a heart failure or the nurses needed to ask Tony some questions about Peter’s physiology, allergies- He had not told the doctor Peter was allergic mint. Even traces of it and Peter’s skin got a rash

wordscorrupt

It was about an hour after the surgery started that one of the nurses approached Tony in he waiting room and he immediately stood up. “He’s doing great. Appendix was nearly rupturing but we got in time. If you want you can follow me and we can go to the recovery area. He’s about to start waking up from the anesthesia.”

irondadgroupie

Tony could feel a real, relieved smile and he thanked the nurse multiple times. His steps were light as he followed the woman and did not pay attention to where they were going. He was making a list in his mind, all the things Peter might need or want while in bed rest, he had to call May and tell her how the surgery went, inform Pepper he would have to take time off work to look after the kid.

wordscorrupt

Tony had finished his list by the time they reached the recovery area. The nurse directed him to the only bed at the moment and Tony rushed over to Peters side immediately. True to the nurses word the boy was just starting to stir.

irondadgroupie

“He might be groggy and confused at first but that is normal,” Nurse told Tony. “Just keep him calm. If he is thirsty, give him some ice chips. If he is in pain, push on the morphine pump once, not more without consulting the doctor first.” Tony nodded at the instructions, rubbing Peter’s arm over the thin blanket. He needed to get the boy a thicker blanket, he must be freezing

wordscorrupt

He asked the nurse to get a warm blanket for his kid and when she returned with it a few minutes later he gently tucked it around Peter leaning over to gently stroke his hair once he was tucked in. That small touch had Peter fluttering his eyes open and Tony encouraged him “Come on kiddo. Time to open your eyes.”

irondadgroupie

Peter kicked slightly and moaned with a grimace. Tony stroked his cheek. “Are you in pain?” Peter sniffed and nodded. “Okay, kiddo,” Tony found the pump and pressed it once. “It’s must be your metabolism, not to mention you are one organ lighter.”

wordscorrupt

Peters eyes widened with fear probably thinking he had one or both his kidneys removed. Tony couldn’t help but laught but quickly calmed the kid down. “Your appendix buddy. Remember? It was just about to burst but we got it out and you’re gonna be good as new in a couple days.”

irondadgroupie

“Oh,” Peter muttered and frowned. “What?” Tony shook his head and tucked the blanket tighter around the child. “Your stomach hurt.” “Yeah.” “You okay now?” “Yeah,” Peter smiled, all loopy and out of it. “Tummy well, not a bitch.”

wordscorrupt

Tony couldn’t help but laugh especially since Peter never really cursed that much around him so hearing this innocent kid swear was funnier than it ought to be. Tony took a seat next to the bed but reach over to continue smoothing Peters hair back offering whatever comfort he could.

irondadgroupie

“You thirsty? I can get you some icechips if you are.“ Peter shook his head and tried to stretch but both pain in his stomach stopped him. "Nope, none of that. You need to lay low and rest. Your body went through quite an ordeal.”

wordscorrupt

Peter sighed. He was alert enough now to begin being tired of having to lay still and cooped up. Tony saw this coming and he was quick to dostract the kid. “Hey bud. Let’s watch a movie in the meanwhile huh?” Peter shook his head a pout forming “I want my bed. I want to leave right now.”

irondadgroupie

“Sorry, no can do,” Tony shook his head. “You need to stay here for at least a day for observation.” Peter kicked his leg. “I’m fine.” “And I am so glad for it but you need to rest. Now, which Harry Potter should we watch?

wordscorrupt

“None of them.” Peter whined his face scrunching up. He huffed trying to sit up because he was tired of laying down but only for his side to shoot up in pain. Tony quickly pushed him back down onto the bed scolding him “You need to be careful Peter!

TBC…maybe?? :)

-wordscorrupt

title: 'Anthony' (Tony&Peter drabble)
body:
Summary: Tony has a panic attack and Pete comes to the rescue

Word count: 841 words

Warnings: PTSD signs, (mentions of) abuse, panic attack

A/N: This is not Starker, just Irondad/Spiderson. 

Tony is busy tinkering with the latest model of his suit. His hands follow the familiar motions, moving almost robotically. His mind wanders from one idea to the other, overflowing with inspiration. The thoughts are not once on the same idea, and it takes away most of Tony’s attention.

Steve enters the room, and sees the genius standing in front of a hologram, seemingly the blueprints of his suit. As he nears Tony, the man doesn’t even look up. At least not until the supersoldier puts a hand on his shoulder.

“Tony.”

Tony full body flinches and he jumps up. A small part of him recognises that it is Steve who is standing in front of him, but the rest of him imagines Howard standing there, a disappointed look on his face. “Anthony.”

It echoes in Tony’s mind. He shakes his head. It is impossible that Howard is here in front of him. Deep inside he knows that. Howard is supposed to be in a coma, presumably almost dead. But that doesn’t stop his heart from increasing in speed or his legs taking him a couple of steps back.

Steve frowns at it, but he doesn’t say anything. Instead he holds out his hands, the palms up. “It’s just me, Tony." 

Tony just stands there for a couple of seconds, before he hesitantly nods. His eyes jump around the room, landing everywhere but on Steve.

The soldier takes Tony’s nod and silence as permission to talk on. "I’ve got good news  for you.” He pauses, waiting for Tony to react. He doesn’t. Steve smiles at him before saying “Your dad’s out of his coma!” He grins at Tony.

Tony, on the other hand, has a completely different reaction. He freezes. His hearts speeds up even more, if that’s even possible.

Steve’s frown returns. He thought he was bringing good news, but judging by Tony’s reaction, it isn’t good at all. “Tony?”

The man doesn’t even register Steve’s voice anymore.

Thump. Thump. Thump.

Steve holds out his hand towards, but after a couple of seconds, he decides against it, letting his arm drop. Instead, he keeps his eyes locked on Tony as he addresses Friday. “Friday, what’s happening?” Tony stumbles backwards, but Steve keeps his eyes on him. “What do I do?”

“Boss seems to be having a panic attack.” The AI’s voice echoes throughout the workshop. “Due to events in Boss’ past, it is advised to not touch him. Instead, it is advised to speak to him in a calm voice until he calms down.”

Something about Friday’s words was off, but Steve decided to ignore it. This wasn’t the moment to think about Tony’s past. He needed to help the man first. “Tony, it’s okay.” He tried to make his voice as calm as he could. “It’s me, Steve.”

“Anthony.” Tony’s breathing is starting to get more ragged. Some part of him knew this wasn’t Howard, but it was overruled by the part that was going Run. Howard is coming. Run and hide. He started to stumble backwards, his teary eyes fixated on Steve.

Said man was lost. He seemed to be making it worse, despite his efforts. “Friday? This isn’t working. What do I do now?”

The AI replied. “Boss is in a severe panic attack. I already requested Peter to come, like he ordered me to do in this situation.”

This made Steve frown for the third time that day. Why would Tony ask for his intern, when he is in such state? He had no clue.

Steve hadn’t much time to think about it either, as his hearing picked up quick footsteps approaching the workshop. Half a second later, a boy burst into the room.

“Mr Stark!” He exclaimed, looking around for him. He spotted the man, who was huddled in a corner of the room. Ignoring Steve, he immediately ran towards Tony. He dropped in front of him and whispered softly “Mr Stark. It’s me, Peter.”

Tony was still shaking. He noticed that he somehow ended up huddled in a corner. But that didn’t matter. What mattered was the boy in front of him, trying to talk with him.

“Hey man. Do you see me?” Peter felt Tony grab his wrists, holding him tightly. Even though he knew he could break out of it, he also knew his mentor needed the comfort.

Tony saw the boy getting clearer. “Kid?”

Peer nodded. “Yup. That’s me. You back with us?”

There was no answer from Tony. Instead, he tugged Peter towards him, pulling him into a hug. The boy climbed into his lap and Tony hugged him even closer.

“It’s okay Tony. Everything’s okay.”

Tony didn’t answer him. He only hugged the boy, trying to ground himself.

Peter grabbed Tony’s hand and put it on his wrist, the man’s fingers on his pulse. “Feel my pulse Tony? Focus on that. Focus on my pulse.”

Tony could only nod.

And Steve stood on the side looking at the pair of them and wondering what the hell is going on.

blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Little Things In the Night
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Yvc5Rc

by SpeckledCoffeeCups

Peter doesn’t like how it feels when he comes down from this, whatever this could be. It doesn’t hurt like he thinks it should. He knows he comes out of the fog and haze of destruction lucky–the thing heals him every time, whispering in the back of his mind, telling him, he’s their’s.

Words: 2323, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Venom (Comics)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

  • Characters: Tony Stark, Peter Parker, Venom Symbiote (Marvel), Loki (Marvel)
  • Relationships: Peter Parker/Tony Stark, Peter Parker & Venom Symbiote, Loki & Peter Parker
  • Additional Tags: Angst with a Happy Ending, Hurt/Comfort, post Endgame, written before endgames release, Implied Smut

by LethalBookshelves

The Rogues think Peter has two moms now.

summary: World of Strange Design - amethyst-noir (Arbonne) - Multifandom [Archive of Our Own]
title: World of Strange Design - amethyst-noir (Arbonne) - Multifandom [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
My gift for @strange-hollow-city for the gift exchange at @ironstrangehaven. I choose the “artist searching for a model prompt” and if I had some sort of artistic talent I would have drawn the picture for you, but sadly I can do only words.

This is same vague AU where some things are the same but most are… not. I really, truly hope that you enjoy it, despite me taking the prompt in rather interesting directions.

This is also my fill for the square “Free For All” @ironstrangebingo.
